Most 100+ stands for 2nd wkt for Ind

dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock b Jadeja 53 (72b 4x4 0x6 97m) SR: 73.61

dismissalComment.html: there's the breakthrough from Jadeja! De Kock went for the orthodox this time for a ball that was quicker and well outside off, it turned it a little, went under de Kock's bat and found the off stump

headshotImage.caption: Hardik Pandya player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Hardik Pandya player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis b Pandya 36 (50b 1x4 0x6 63m) SR: 72

dismissalComment.html: beautiful bowling! No more can you say Hardik's a blind hit-the-deck-get-flogged bowler. Out comes the slower ball, understanding that South Africa, at this point, only dare to use the pace of the bowler, and not set the pace themselves. So he sneaks in the slower ball. The offcutter, on and around off stump. It completely deceives the batsman. Du Plessis, who has been hanging on the back foot, has to come forward, but his balance is off. He throws his hands at the ball, gets an inside edge and hears that ungodly rattle behind him

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: edged and taken. Rabada goes. Bhuvneshwar strikes. Impeccable line and length from Bhuvneshwar. Hits a good length, pitches on middle, seams away late. Takes the outside edge and Dhoni dives forward to complete the catch. Just enough lateral movement. More would have beat the edge, less would have hit the middle.

one more. It's all falling apart for South Africa. Great length this. Back of a length on the fourth-stump channel. The No. 10 batsman looks to drive with his bat well away from the body. Gets a thick outside edge and carries to a wide slip where Kohli takes a good catch to his left. Two in two.

headshotImage.caption: Jasprit Bumrah player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jasprit Bumrah player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: top edge and it's taken by square leg. South Africa continue to self-destruct. Who's let Dee Dee near the red button?! (Sorry to those who've never watched Dexter's Lab). Right, onto describing things. It's a short ball, on off stump, Morris takes it on with a big heave. But he has no room to play the pull and the lesson of what happens to a batsman when he plays that shot regardless will be etched into his mind forever

headshotImage.caption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: whew, that's mighty close. And Kohli asks Dhoni, then Bumrah, then chooses to review. All this needs to do is hit Phehlukwayo in line. It was a low full toss, straight, and definitely hitting the stumps. Phehlukwayo misses the full toss and is truck in line, the ball goes on to hit the stumps and SA slump further. He has missed a straight full toss. Umpire Reiffel somehow missed that one

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla c Dhoni b Ashwin 35 (54b 3x4 1x6 69m) SR: 64.81

dismissalComment.html: and a wicket. Ashwin strikes. Flat and wide outside off, the ball skids on and Amla is slightly late in his cut. Gets a thick edge and a pretty significant deflection. Dhoni stands his ground, gets his gloves in an excellent position and takes a lovely catch. Quickened up off the surface there. Decent knock from Amla, set a strong platform for SA

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers run out (Pandya/Dhoni) 16 (12b 1x4 0x6 16m) SR: 133.33

dismissalComment.html: AB might be run-out here! Yep. Hardik's throw comes on time and Dhoni does the rest. South Africa's Superman put in the dive, looking very much like his nickname, but he wasn't quick enough this time. Not really a single there, but he responds to du Plessis looking up after patting the ball towards point. Hardik swoops in and sends a rocket throw right beside the stumps

headshotImage.caption: Jasprit Bumrah player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jasprit Bumrah player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: David Miller run out (Bumrah/Kohli) 1 (3b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: and someone's gone! Both batsmen at the same end, and the third umpire has to come in to adjudicate which one of them is out. Early signs are that Miller should be run-out. What a waste. South Africa bottling things up after withstanding to pressure so well. So how did this mess happen? Well, it begins with a quicker delivery that doesn't turn. And because of that du Plessis making room to cut gets an outside edge to short third man. He sets off, then hesitates, then sets off again, and du Plessis going a second time gives Miller the go ahead to run as hard as he needs to. Only problem is by that time du Plessis again changes his mind and dives back into his batting crease, before Miller makes it. The throw, such a poor one aimed at the batsman's end, fortuitously ends up at the bowlers. Kohli collects it and breaks the stumps to seal the absolute mess.

dismissalText.commentary: Imran Tahir run out (Kohli/Dhoni) 1 (7b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 14.28

dismissalComment.html: swung away. What is happening. Is that another run-out? There was a misfield. Tahir is run-out by a distance and South Africa are all out. Back of a length on leg, pulled to deep midwicket. Duminy wants two, but Tahir sends him back. After the misfield though, Tahir calls him through. But by then, the throw is already in and Duminy won't be able to make it. So he sends Tahir back, who dives but Dhoni takes the bails off in time.

dismissalText.long: c du Plessis b Imran Tahir
dismissalText.commentary: Shikhar Dhawan c du Plessis b Imran Tahir 78 (83b 12x4 1x6 130m) SR: 93.97

dismissalComment.html: it'll stop temporarily, in the search of the hundred. Dhawan runs down at the googly, the ball turns away, takes the outside half and lobs towards long-off where du Plessis hurries to his right to make a tough catch look incredibly simple. End of a sensational innings, one that has all but put South Africa out of yet another global event

dismissalText.commentary: Virat Kohli not out 76 (101b 7x4 1x6 136m) SR: 75.24

dismissalComment.html: that's needless - so for this match, par for the course. Rohit moves leg side, well before the bowler lets it go, Morkel has the chance to follow him with a good length ball. The batsman looks to launch it down to Cardiff, just in case the teams there don't have enough balls, but in the end he nicks off to the keeper

headshotImage.caption: Jasprit Bumrah player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jasprit Bumrah player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: finished with a six, and India seal their semi-final spot. Drops short on middle and leg, Yuvraj goes back and says thanks with a swat over midwicket. South Africa knocked out of yet another global event

commentPostTextItems.html: 6.50pm A resounding performance from India put SA out of their misery. SA were so under-par for the majority of the day that they didn't deserve to be in the official knockouts. Virat Kohli was at it again, the chasing master. Saw off a testing opening spell and then just did Virat Kohli, taking India through. Shikhar Dhawan was terrific. Cliched yes, but this was a complete India performance from the start, keeping the SA openers on a tight leash and it resulted in tight singles that shouldn't have been. Thereon, there was just one winner. India will play Bangladesh in one semi final, a repeat of the 2015 World Cup quarter-final. And South Africa may go home for a bit before returning to England for the Tests.

Virat Kohli: "A good toss to win, the wicket didn't change too much. A decent wicket to bat on. The fielkders backed our bowlers. The opportunity comes your way, you have to grab it. Always good to get him out early, he can always hurt you (AB de Villiers). We wanted to step up that intensity. Important for someone to bat till the end, but Shikhar's intent was outstanding. This is probably our best game we played so far. We played in Birmingham, we like that pitch, suits our game. No looking back. Always room for improvement, always small point you can improve on, can't rest on your laurels.

AB de Villiers: Not an ideal way to finish. Credit to them in those first 15-20 overs, put the pressure on us, we normally don't bat that way. We never got going, very sad obviously, We were hoping to play a better game of cricket. Came unstuck against a better team. Couldn't it get away. A lot of soft dismissals."

Jaspirit Bumrah is the Man of the Match: "An important game for us. We wanted to be calm and execute our plans. I'm happy with any role given to me. As long as you're contributing, it's good. The ball doesn't swing too much, so stick to the basic,s bowl a hard length, don't give room. A good toss to win, chasing has been relatively easier."

commentPreTextItems.html: Vikas Vadgama: "@Dipanjan, you just can't compare runs, Yuvraj batted most of his career at 5 or 6 whereas Kohli at 3 or 4. Obviously, Kohli had more time to settle down and score runs."

commentTextItems.html: 93 kph, on the pads, misses a flick does Yuvraj. Struck on the pad
a yorker on leg, 92 kph. Kohli wanted to sweep but is so full, so he improvises a flick to deep midwicket

commentPreTextItems.html: Vishal: "Kohli is in the top 7 in terms of most runs - and they say that he is out of form..."

commentTextItems.html: clipped to deep midwicket
sliced through point for two. Tossed up outside off, skewed away in his search for a drive

commentPreTextItems.html: So, India are not the only ones cruising to victory at the moment. Rafael Nadal has just crushed Stanislas Wawrinka on the way to a staggering 10th French Open title, breaking several records in the process."

commentTextItems.html: tossed up outside off, driven to cover

commentPostTextItems.html: Shahab khan: "Currently all four asian teams are alive. one will go home tomorrow. but still three out of four asians in semifinalist, great acheivement"

commentTextItems.html: a googly outside off, Yuvraj goes back and guides a cut to the sweeper cover
gets forward and defends
shortish and wide, sliced to the sweeper cover
picks length early. He has been the best player of Tahir I've seen. Drops short on middle, it still skids on but Kohli goes back and swats a pull through midwicket. Wow
worked towards square leg
flat outside off, spins back in. Pushed away towards cover
slower on off, played towards square leg
flat on off, inside-edged towards third man. Takes a run
quick and straight, full, no turn. Smothered back

commentPostTextItems.html: soumith potturi: "Disagree with you, people who watched it could easily say it was also going down the leg, let alone pitching outside leg. And he did review when it looked close. You need to not use it for the sake of using it."

commentTextItems.html: fuller on leg, kept out by Yuvraj
quick and straight, flicked to deep midwicket. Another run

commentPostTextItems.html: Sarthak Baral: "And this is why Virat is the best chaser in the world, started off very shaky but he rode that period and now he's close to seeing his team home, great batting."

commentPreTextItems.html: Dipanjan Mitra: "Can't imagine the difference between the 2 present batsmen at the crease, Yuvraj and Kohli, in terms of ODI runs is just 700. and the latter has played 117 games less. "

commentTextItems.html: flat outside off, pushed to the sweeper cover from the back foot

commentPostTextItems.html: Simba: "SA chokes again in a major tournament. Its a pity they just could not play their natural game....."

commentTextItems.html: slower, straight, guided down to third man.
overpitched outside off, pushed up to long-off

one more. It's all falling apart for South Africa. Great length this. Back of a length on the fourth-stump channel. The No. 10 batsman looks to drive with his bat well away from the body. Gets a thick outside edge and carries to a wide slip where Kohli takes a good catch to his left. Two in two.

and a wicket. Ashwin strikes. Flat and wide outside off, the ball skids on and Amla is slightly late in his cut. Gets a thick edge and a pretty significant deflection. dismissalComment.html: beautiful bowling! No more can you say Hardik's a blind hit-the-deck-get-flogged bowler. Out comes the slower ball, understanding that South Africa, at this point, only dare to use the pace of the bowler, and not set the pace themselves. So he sneaks in the slower ball. The offcutter, on and around off stump. It completely deceives the batsman. Du Plessis, who has been hanging on the back foot, has to come forward, but his balance is off. He throws his hands at the ball, gets an inside edge and hears that ungodly rattle behind him
there's the breakthrough from Jadeja! De Kock went for the orthodox this time for a ball that was quicker and well outside off, it turned it a little, went under de Kock's bat and found the off stump

headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers run out (Pandya/Dhoni) 16 (12b 1x4 0x6 16m) SR: 133.33

dismissalComment.html: AB might be run-out here! Yep. Hardik's throw comes on time and Dhoni does the rest. South Africa's Superman put in the dive, looking very much like his nickname, but he wasn't quick enough this time. Not really a single there, but he responds to du Plessis looking up after patting the ball towards point. Hardik swoops in and sends a rocket throw right beside the stumps

headshotImage.caption: Jasprit Bumrah player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jasprit Bumrah player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: David Miller run out (Bumrah/Kohli) 1 (3b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: and someone's gone! Both batsmen at the same end, and the third umpire has to come in to adjudicate which one of them is out. Early signs are that Miller should be run-out. What a waste. South Africa bottling things up after withstanding to pressure so well. So how did this mess happen? Well, it begins with a quicker delivery that doesn't turn. And because of that du Plessis making room to cut gets an outside edge to short third man. He sets off, then hesitates, then sets off again, and du Plessis going a second time gives Miller the go ahead to run as hard as he needs to. Only problem is by that time du Plessis again changes his mind and dives back into his batting crease, before Miller makes it. The throw, such a poor one aimed at the batsman's end, fortuitously ends up at the bowlers. Kohli collects it and breaks the stumps to seal the absolute mess.

headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Imran Tahir run out (Kohli/Dhoni) 1 (7b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 14.28

dismissalComment.html: swung away. What is happening. Is that another run-out? There was a misfield. Tahir is run-out by a distance and South Africa are all out. Back of a length on leg, pulled to deep midwicket. Duminy wants two, but Tahir sends him back. After the misfield though, Tahir calls him through. But by then, the throw is already in and Duminy won't be able to make it. So he sends Tahir back, who dives but Dhoni takes the bails off in time.

dismissalText.commentary: Rohit Sharma c de Kock b Morkel 12 (20b 1x4 1x6 23m) SR: 60

dismissalComment.html: that's needless - so for this match, par for the course. Rohit moves leg side, well before the bowler lets it go, Morkel has the chance to follow him with a good length ball. The batsman looks to launch it down to Cardiff, just in case the teams there don't have enough balls, but in the end he nicks off to the keeper

dismissalText.long: c du Plessis b Imran Tahir
dismissalText.commentary: Shikhar Dhawan c du Plessis b Imran Tahir 78 (83b 12x4 1x6 130m) SR: 93.97

dismissalComment.html: it'll stop temporarily, in the search of the hundred. Dhawan runs down at the googly, the ball turns away, takes the outside half and lobs towards long-off where du Plessis hurries to his right to make a tough catch look incredibly simple. End of a sensational innings, one that has all but put South Africa out of yet another global event
